0A1029D359A042B69EC518ADA1839128.description: SSCI.G.23.b: describe how the space program has enhanced international cooperation and examine the possibility of using the space program to provide solutions to world problems

B2576A3666EA474AA316B5ABE2BD6393.description: SSCI.G.23.a: examine the use of technology to expand knowledge and achievement's and analyze the positive and negative effects of such on the quality of life

58A0BFE039F94605A1A89B051666F6F1.description: SSCI.G.23: analyze the costs, benefits, and opportunities presented by technology as a means to address political, social, and economic problems

D888CD85D163427B9E92B8887DF5A35A.description: SSCI.F.22.c: compare and contrast efforts throughout the world to calm ethnic tensions and to move toward a more stable and balanced political environment

A53354D062914449AA9FAB337E92D3E1.description: SSCI.F.22.b: examine the use by some radical groups of violence to focus attention to their causes

3150F124E6F445F9A691A89CB4359A44.description: SSCI.F.22.a: evaluate the method used by many radical groups of blaming minority populations for causing economic social and political problems, including the reasons for using that method and its repercussions

609C6D4BDC814AFF870D193AE3C8A107.description: SSCI.F.22: analyze the causes for the growth of radical groups throughout the world and the effects of such growth

7C38AC27D0CD4147BA661F01B5833AE8.description: SSCI.F.21.c: examine the ways in which our society can benefit from cultural diversity

49D1A91A1B884D23990B132900245836.description: SSCI.F.21.b: identify challenges that arise from difference in cultural values, beliefs, and norms in a multicultural society, and analyze how these differences affect the political, social, an educational foundations of society

A539A2A522064B0EB465F267BDE6CB08.description: SSCI.F.21.a: describe the causes which led to the growing diversity of American society

B8B1E3FD155F4E6FAA32C4DC167539F4.description: SSCI.F.21: recognize the growing diversity of American society

835DA18166F5457CB3E7E3AA31069556.description: SSCI.F.20.b: identify violations of human rights and examine the obligation of the United States in regard to these violations

AC37FCF8E5DA4C489A8C83B236F92A21.description: SSCI.F.20.a: differentiate between statements or declarations of human rights which have been set forth by different cultures or other entities and examine how they affect the human condition

18D03E3A223E491CB17E4851458B855D.description: SSCI.F.20: analyze the major issues regarding international human rights

AA559E3BEA72477ABF88746CF418D2F9.description: SSCI.F: Human Rights and Societal Issues

889378DF0570483C9977B2B04A80ABC6.description: SSCI.E.19.c: identify the challenges and pressures faced by public schools and examine feasible types of improvements which students will need to prepare for the challenges of the 21st Century

BE53EBA361444117AE6B2BD314A60EE8.description: SSCI.E.19.b: examine changes in the family structure and analyze responses to those changes by churches, schools, governmental agencies, and the judicial system

784826C52F4140F099C1B4BBFBDCCBE7.description: SSCI.E.19.a: examine problems associated with major urban centers and evaluate alternative solutions which are being considered by local, state, and national agencies

5C3A91EED0B2426DA17913CCA93FECB4.description: SSCI.E.19: describe the challenges relating to urbanization and changes in family and household structure

AE95FB40F5594AA5A4FBE15775DCE5D2.description: SSCI.D.18.d: evaluate the possibilities and repercussions of plant and animal extinction, including the causes and potential solutions

795054B7748A444BA9D3F6F988D5E91D.description: SSCI.D.18.c: compare and contrast the future potential of traditional sources of energy and the possible development of new sources of energy as they relate to social and economic needs projected in to the 21st Century

1B725AB0B65047678BCD785A9F78136B.description: SSCI.D.18.b: examine the current and projected world population growth rate, analyzing the challenges resulting from such growth

5364ADAB55D94C688331DEC573789F88.description: SSCI.D.18.a: evaluate the response of governments and environmental groups to the effects of continued erosion and pollution of the earth's natural resources, recognizing environmental issues and potential solutions

17E1937754764A9AA4837B090873F106.description: SSCI.D.18: analyze the struggle between environmental protection and economic progress

4CC19C52FAAC49BFB5D047C69F1105C4.description: SSCI.C.17.b: compare and contrast areas of the world classified as IAC (Industrially Advanced Countries) and LDC (Less Developed Countries)

6CE245658323407AB67003FE5179FF2A.description: SSCI.C.17.a: evaluate the positive and negative influences on society that have resulted from world economic interdependence, including specific economic agreements; examples can include GATT (General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade), United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA)and EEC (European Economic Community)

BE8889C594EB4779A26EAE0AF7D7D3A6.description: SSCI.C.17: analyze current trends leading to international economic cooperation

119395EC52284346A23093B9B5488BAB.description: SSCI.B.16.a: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by introducing a topic and organizing complex ideas, concepts, and information so that each new element builds on that which precedes it to create a unified whole; including formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension

87D72241AC994D14B0400E33373C3652.description: SSCI.B.15.g: draw evidence from informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research

4FFF602BCD8E40B8BCFC1455630C90AD.description: SSCI.B.15.f: gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the strengths and limitations of each source in terms of the specific task, purpose, and audience; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and overreliance on any one source and following a standard format for citation

F79D7DEC3B6C44ECAAB7D5FF4FF95467.description: SSCI.B.15.e: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by using precise language, domain-specific vocabulary and techniques such as metaphor, simile, and analogy to manage the complexity of the topic; conveying a knowledgeable stance in a style that responds to the discipline and context as well as to the expertise of likely readers

8A85850A1FB8495681BA823B7DBA66BB.description: SSCI.B.15.d: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by using varied transitions and sentence structures to link the major sections of the text, creating cohesion, and clarifying the relationships among complex ideas and concepts
